ygData.subject: EQ-Quest Soulfire Walkthroughs
ygData.msgSnippet: Here are two walkthroughs for the soulfire that I have come across, one from Holyswords list and the other from EQCheats list. Hope it helps you since it will
ygData.messageBody:
Here are two walkthroughs for the soulfire that I have come across, one from
Holyswords list and the other from EQCheats list. Hope it helps you since it
will be a while before I get one for my paladin.


Grady Knightmare
Veeshan Server

>>>First, basic info. Soulfire is a Holy Sword. Zimel's Blades is the name
>of a
>>>quest for this Holy Sword. The Zimel's Blades quest is given by the
Female
>>>Paladin in the Hall of Truth in Freeport. If you are not from the
Paladin
>>>guild in Freeport you may have difficulty starting this quest. If that
>is the
>>>case there are many ways to improve your faction with the Knights of
>Truth. I
>>>will go in to that later. There is also some issue about what level you
>need
>>>to be to start the quest. I started in Freeport, and was able to start
the
>>>quest at first level, and still start it up to 8th. Since I passed 8th I
am
>>>told I am to experienced to start the quest. Other players of even 12th
have
>>>been told they are not experienced enough. I don't know what causes this.
>One
>>>last thing before I begin. This is BY FAR the longest and most complex
>>>quest I
>>>have seen in this game, so this description, while basic, is VERY LONG.
>>>
>>>Hail the Female Paladin on the top of the Hall of Truth. Say something
>to the
>>>effect of "I will" and then the test in brackets. When you say the right
>>>thing
>>>she will hand you a letter to deliver to a spy the Paladins have in the
>>>Militia. You are to say "Truth is Good" to this Militia guard and then
give
>>>him the letter. Go through the Militia house until you exit into the
small
>>>grassy area. Right behind the door is a Guard (he is directly to your
right
>>>when you walk into the grassy are and is hidden behind the door so many
>people
>>>miss him the first time). Walk up to him and hail him. He will respond,
>>>which
>>>is something guards don't normally do. Say "Truth is Good" he will
respond
>>>again. Give him the letter. He will give you a note that says Zimel's
>Blades
>>>on it with a lot of dots. Leave the Militia building (the guard will be
>>>attacked and killed soon after giving you the note) and head to North
>>>Freeport.
>>>This is where the quest gets a little screwy. It is though to be broken,
>but
>>>not so much that you can't continue it. Ok, let me explain.
>>>
>>>You are supposed to bring the note back to the Female Paladin. When you
>hand
>>>it to her you get exp. and faction adjustments. She tells you she knows
>>>nothing of Zimel's Blades and can't read the rest of the document, but to
go
>>>talk to someone (she will give you the name) at the Office of the People,
>>>which
>>>is right next door to the Hall of Truth. She DOES NOT give you the note
>back,
>>>which she should because you need it later in the quest. So what do you
do?
>>>You start the quest over again, and this time you skip the Female
>Paladin, and
>>>bring the note right to the lady at the Office of the People. She is
>>>upstairs,
>>>and if you ask "Who is Zimel" she will give you information that
>continues the
>>>quest. I have been told you can give her the note and she tells you she
>can't
>>>read it. I never did this my self but if you do give her the note and
she
>>>doesn't give it back, you need to get it again.
>>>
>>>What she tells you that is useful is that a Dwarf named Groflah, who owns
>and
>>>runs Groflah's Fine Steel (or something like that) also in North Freeport
>>>was a
>>>friend of Zimel and might have more information. She also tells you that
>>>Zimel's Blades is condemned. You need to do TWO things now.
>>>
>>>First go back to the Female Paladin and tell her "Zimels Blades in
>condemned"
>>>(this is where I first got stuck because I tried telling her Zimel's
>Blades is
>>>condemned and that didn't work) If you say it right she will tell you a
>>>little
>>>about Soulfire (the first time you hear about it). If you say the wrong
>thing
>>>you won't get a response. Just try a combination of Zimel's, Zimel,
Zimels,
>>>Blades, and Blade until you get it right.
>>>
>>>Second, go talk to Groflah. His shop is very near the Bard guild in
North
>>>Freeport. Go around behind the counter and upstairs. If you say "Who is
>>>Zimel" he says something like "Zimel, I don't know what you are talking
>about.
>>>I won't talk here". Now give him the note. He will tell give you LOTS
of
>>>information and tell you to meet him in Seafarer's Roost at night and
>give him
>>>the note again for him to decode it. He DOES give you the note back.
>>>
>>>Now comes the waiting game. Go to Seafarer's Roost, which is on the
>docks in
>>>East Freeport. Groflah usually shows up around 3 am, but I have seen him
as
>>>early as 6 pm and as late as 8 am, and he doesn't show up every night.
>When he
>>>does show up, say "Who is Zimel" and you start to hear the real story.
Give
>>>him the note and he will decode it giving you even more information. Now
>you
>>>know that Zimel is missing, he probably is the ONLY one who knows where
>>>Soulfire is, and both Lucan (the Fallen Paladin who leads the corrupt
>militia
>>>in Freeport) and Peitro Zarn (the head of the Shadow Knight guild in
>Freeport)
>>>are looking for this sword, and are probably working together. You are
also
>>>led to believe that the sword is a Holy Sword because while Peitro Zarn
>had it
>>>in his possession at one time, he could not yield it.
>>>
>>>While you were in Seafarer's Roost waiting for Groflah, you probably
noticed
>>>many NPCs coming and going at all hours. One NPC, a drunk named Tykar
>Renlin,
>>>holds the next piece of the puzzle. He usually shows up around 1 AM. If
>you
>>>hail him and say "Who is Zimel" he will tell you that he knows Zimel and
>would
>>>love to talk to him. Tykar Renlin also tells you he is thirsty and would
>like
>>>a drink first. You need to give Tykar Renlin 4 Drom's Champagnes. These
>>>should be purchasable from the bartender. They are Lore items, so you
>need to
>>>give him one at a time. Once you give him 4 he will give you a Blanket
>>>(also a
>>>lore item) and tell you that Zimel is a prisoner locked in a cell below
the
>>>Arena.
>>>
>>>>Give Zimel the three things he wants: Bog juice, edible goo and his
>>>blanket. One at a time, in that order. Bog Juice is made by mixing 1
>>>Bottle + 1 Flask of Water + 1 Snake Scales. Zimel gives you a key marked
>>>H.K. 102. Go to Highkeep, give the BANK clerk the key after hailing her.
>>>She gives you a letter to give to Brother Hayle, a captive in Splitpaw
>>>dungeon. Give him the note,
>>>which he will give back to you. Ask him about the "proof of Nobility" and
>>>he will tell you that he wants the Hilt of Soulfire, which is on a SK
troll
>>>named Xicotl in Mistmoore castle guest room, a sword of faith from
Freeport
>>>and a Testimony of truth, along with the returned note as proof nobility.
>>You get the Brilliant Sword of Faith from killing Sir Lucan in the Militia
>>House of West Freeport. He's a level 48 mob, and for how tough he is to
>>kill the sword is a joke.
>>When you kill him, you get his testimony and bring it back to the Hall of
>>Truth, where you are rewarded with a very crappy sword for all your
trouble.
>>You need very good faction with the Knights of Tunare to talk with brother
>>Hayle. Hayle will then give you Soulfire. It looks just like the flaming
>sword that Aradune (Brad McQuaid's) character uses.
>>
>>Stats are reportedly:
>>
>>2 H slashing
>>no drop
>>damage 28
>>delay 45
>>+7 str/+7 wis
>>effect: complete heal (5 charges)
>>
>>
Here is the entire Soulfire quest, the way I understand it:

1. Get the note from Kalatrina in the Hall of Truth, top level.
2. Go to the spy, tell him 'Truth is good', and then give him the
letter.
3. After the Guard kills him, take his note and you are supposed to
give it to her, but she doesn't hand it back to you, so skip this part
of the quest. She noramlly tells you to go to
the Office of the People and speak with the woman there, but I'm
telling you right now.
4. At the Office of the People, you are again supposed to give her the
note, but she also doesn't give it back. Simply tell her "Who is
Zimel?', and she will tell you about Groflah, and
that Zimel's Blades in condemned.
5. First, go to the Hall of Truth, and tell Kalatrina that 'Zimels
Baldes is condemned.'. I believe this is where you first hear about
Soulfire (or is it the time you give it to her the
first time, I haven't done this part in a while).
6. Now, go to Groflah's Forge, and ask him 'Who is Zimel?'. He will
give you a negative response, and then give him the Zimel's Blades
note. He will tell you to meet him in the
Seafarer's Roost.
7. Go to the Seafarer's Roost (at the docks in East Freeport), and
wait for Groflah to show up. He is usually there at 3 am, but it's
fairly ramdom. When he shows, again ask him 'Who is
Zimel?', and he'll tell you about he's buddies with old Zimel. Now
give him the note, and he'll decode it for you. It says 'H E L P C A
P T I V E', on it, implying that the prisoner
under the arena is Zimel (as we suspected for some time).
8. While waiting at the Seafarer's Roost, do NOT go AFK, as you will
miss a crucial part of the quest. Randomly a drunk named Tykar Renlin
will show up, and will cuss out Captain Lucan
when a bard sings a song about him. He also says that Lucan imprisoned
him and his buddy, old Zimel. Ask him 'Who is Zimel?' and he will ask
you for a drink. Give him 4 Drom's
Champagnes, and he will give you a blanket called 'Bunker Cell #2' (I
think, but it's not important what it's called).
9. Go to the prisoner under the Arena. Hail him, and ask him 'Who is
Zimel?'. He will 'Stare deeply into your eyes', and say nothing. Ask
him 'Where is Soulfire?', and he'll ramble
something along the lines of 'Bog n Goo!! Freezing!! Hungry!!
Thirsty too!!'. This implies that he needs two items.
10. Go kill some snakes and get a few Snake Scales off them. Put them
in a brew barrel with a bottle, and a flask of water. This will give
you 'Bog Juice', one of the items that Zimel
asks for (Bog n Goo; this is the Bog, now for the Goo...)
11. Get some Fire Beetle Eyes (if you don't know where to get these,
you don't deserve Soulfire), and Rat ears, and put them into an oven.
You get 'Edible Goo', which Zimel also asks for
(This is the Goo part...)
12. Give the 'Bunker Cell #2', the 'Bog Juice', and the 'Edible Goo'
to Zimel. He gives you a key called H.K. 102, and he mutters something
about Tunaria's Corridor. If you've done the
Princess Quest in High Keep, you know what to do...
13. Take the Key to High Keep (located in Highpass Hold; this is the
narrow pass between Qeynos and Freeport, and the coninent used to be
called Tunaria, hence, Tunaria's Corridor). Give
the key to the Clerk in the bank, that's it. You get a note from Hayle
Mool, addressed to Zimel. It tells you to come get him in Qeynos, but
if you've been there before, you know he's
being held in Splitpaw...
14. In Splitpaw, find him (don't ask...) and give him the note. He
will tell you something I forgot already, but then you ask him 'What is
the Proof of Nobility?'. He will tell you that
he requires the note you gave him, The Brilliant Sword of Faith, the
Glowing Sword Hilt, and the Testimony of Truth (some of which are
sub-quests, explained below).
15. At this point, I HAVE NOT given him the items, at least in the
correct manner (long story, and rather embarassing; I'd perfer if you
didn't ask...). If you give the items one at a
time, I have heard (though this is not confirmed) he will hand you over
the Soulfire! Congrats, you should have the blade if you're smarter
than I am!

THE TEST OF TRUTH

This is also started in the Hall of Truth, and may not be started after
level 8. This is a very simple quest, so I will not explain it here...

THE BRILLIANT SWORD OF FAITH

1. Speak with the Paladin Guild Master at the top of the Hall of
Truth, and ask him everything pertaining to killing Lucan D'lere.
2. Once you have gotten the quest, assemble a team of TONS of level 45
plus people, because Captain Lucan is the badass leader of the Warrior
Guild in Freeport, and the head of the
Freeport Militia. He's level 48, so make sure you've got PLENTY of
time to spend killing him, since he's TOUGH. Tonight on my server
(Rodcet Nife) a group of about 20 level 40+ people
LOST to this bugger, and only killed him after dying three or four
times each.
3. If you get his Testimony from him (which rarely spawns, God knows
why...), return it to the man who gave you the quest, and he forks over
the Brilliant Sword of Faith.

GLOWING SWORD HILT

This is gained off a Shadow Knight in Mistmoore named Xicotl. I am not
sure, but I think it spawns every time, and he's in either the Guest
House or the Throne Room, if I recall
correctly. He's surrounded by other Shadow Knights and Necros, so be
prepared for another tough battle (though not as tough as the bloodbath
when you fight Lucan, that's just BRUTAL). I
should point out that whenever this guy gets pulled, the whole zone
clears, so be warned...


That's my take on Soulfire, correct me if I'm wrong... But I'm not. :
)

Regards,
Praetor, Paladin of Life
Knights Templar
